definition: lump (of earth)/chunk/piece/classifier for pieces of cloth, cake, soap etc/(coll.) classifier for money and currency units

sentences.english: The the stem tuber buds is the appropriate ex-plants of rapid propagation of colorful Zantedeschia.

sentences.english: The anthocyanidins discovered in the purple tubers are the most diverse.

sentences.english: Browning rule and diversified color stabilizing methods in fresh konjac tuber process has been studied.

sentences.english: A tetrasaccharide found in the tubers of the chinese artichoke.

sentences.english: Modern research has shown, for orchids gastrodia tuber parasitic plant dry for many years.
sentences.chinese: 現代研究表明，天麻爲蘭科多年寄生植物的乾燥塊莖。

sentences.english: Compared with grains, tubers are inherently more productive.
sentences.chinese: 與穀類相比，塊莖天生高產。

sentences.english: This year, we used the purplish tuber in taro and pumpkin tofu puffs.
sentences.chinese: 這年，我們用紫色塊莖中的芋頭，南瓜豆腐泡。

sentences.english: But, according to our test, it is the mycelia in tubers that are mainly the preliminary infections source.
sentences.chinese: 試驗證明，初侵染主要來源爲塊莖中的休眠菌絲。
